For all natural numbers `a`, `0 ≤ a`. (Zero is less than or equal to every natural number.)

name: Nat.min_zero
docString: For all natural numbers `a`, `0 ≤ a`. (Zero is less than or equal to every natural number.)

This theorem states that for any rational number 'a', the numerator of 'a' (a.num) is non-negative (greater than or equal to zero) if and only if 'a' itself is non-negative. In other words, it establishes that the sign of a rational number is determined by the sign of its numerator.

name: Rat.num_nonneg
docString: This theorem states that for any rational number 'a', the numerator of 'a' (a.num) is non-negative (greater than or equal to zero) if and only if 'a' itself is non-negative. In other words, it establishes that the sign of a rational number is determined by the sign of its numerator.

For every finite set of natural numbers, there exists a natural number that is an upper bound for the set.

type: ∀ (s : Finset ℕ), ∃ n, s ⊆ Finset.range n
name: Finset.exists_nat_subset_range
docString: For every finite set of natural numbers, there exists a natural number that is an upper bound for the set.

This theorem states that for any positive number `n` (type `PosNum`), when converted to a natural number (using the ↑ symbol), it will be greater than 0. In other words, any positive number remains strictly positive even when viewed as a natural number.

name: PosNum.to_nat_pos
docString: This theorem states that for any positive number `n` (type `PosNum`), when converted to a natural number (using the ↑ symbol), it will be greater than 0. In other words, any positive number remains strictly positive even when viewed as a natural number.

A sum of finite numbers is still finite

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {s : Finset α} {f : α → ENNReal}, (∀ a ∈ s, f a ≠ ⊤) → (Finset.sum s fun a => f a) < ⊤
name: ENNReal.sum_lt_top
docString: A sum of finite numbers is still finite

A sum of numbers is infinite iff one of them is infinite

type:
∀ {ι : Type u_1} {M : Type u_4} [inst : AddCommMonoid M] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithTop M},
  (Finset.sum s fun i => f i) = ⊤ ↔ ∃ i ∈ s, f i = ⊤
name: WithTop.sum_eq_top_iff
docString: A sum of numbers is infinite iff one of them is infinite

name: CoalgebraStruct.counit
